instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.BKLT_SD: What is BKLT_SD? BKLT_SD is a pin of the LED driver that goes to the voltage divider that feeds the gate of the transistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H and the backlight circuit. The LED driver will short this pin to ground when backlight circuit is ready to turn on. Prerequisites are 1) it is told to turn on via enable signal, the screen has communicated with the LED driver 2) current sensing circuit is working 3) does not detect an over-current situation such as the backlight power rail being shorted to ground.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> TOUCH BAR model . NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
Hi all,



This is a liquid damaged board but tiny bit near the lcd connector. I check the LCD  with working board and LCD by itself is fine. I replaced the LCD flex cable still the same with damaged board.

macbook works fine with external monitor. but with the internal display not sure if this is only backlight or no display as really hard to see  the picture on this model LCD's.

I checked backlight circuit. 

<CHIP>U8400</CHIP> get current sensing power 12.66/12.67v on pin 9/10. But <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> signal is missing.  diod mode its 0.372v.\

<SIGNAL>BKLT_SD</SIGNAL> is 12.67v and <TRANSISTOR>Q8400</TRANSISTOR> not opeing the gate.

Check on J8500 LCD connector . There is 5v on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>
on pin 45.

Any clue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> TOUCH BAR model . NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
You must change <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.
Liquid spilled from pin 43 to pin1 of J8500 killed GMUX.
You are lucky enough; this board has GMUX, that signal doesn't go directly to CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> TOUCH BAR model . NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: Hi thank you for your reply. I replced <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>. still no display. <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> pin 2 and 44 gets 3.3v. <SIGNAL>LCD_MUX_SEL</SIGNAL> 3.3v shooting from the SMC.  any clue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> TOUCH BAR model . NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message: Just  let you knwo. I have replaced the <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> from same <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> donner board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> TOUCH BAR model . NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> is required to detect the LCD.
You should change <CHIP>U9800</CHIP> too.
Which pins of J8500 have been affected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> TOUCH BAR model . NO BACKLIGHT
threads.message:
HI,  board siede pins are all clear and no liquid onlt LCD 
 conncetor . but LCD works fine after cleaning as i tested with working board. pins around 45,41,29,37 & 46, 42, 40, 38. I will change u980o update you now. really appreciate your help.

threads.message: Hi, so sorry for not getting back for a month. I was out of the counrty for a month. I just wanted to tell you that I replaced the <CHIP>U9800</CHIP> again and its working fine. Thank you so much for help.
